text:
Hi guys, I hope you're all really, really well. 
I'm going to show you how to make the most

beautiful dessert. It's a French toast panettone 
pudding. It's really quick to put together, around

15 minutes start to finish, and it's so, so good. 
It's perfect for this time of year when we get

into the festive season because there's panettones 
everywhere, and this recipe is from my new book

Together. Now this book is all about feasting 
and I've done a feast for all kinds of different

occasions. One of the chapters, one of the feasts 
in here, is called Last Minute Feast and the idea

is, how can you do an incredible dinner party 
which is absolutely safe, secure, delicious,

but easy, and quick, and makes it look like you've 
put a lot of thought into it? So this dessert

is perfect, it's a win-win. So it's from that 
chapter, let's make it it's so good. Get yourself

a nice non-stick pan. First job is just take 
a little bit of butter, just like a nice knob,

put it into here and we're just going to rub it 
around the bottom like that, and that's going

to give it a nice golden crispy outside. Next job 
we're going to take this beautiful panettone. Now

you could have leftover panettone no trouble 
at all, or you could buy one. What I want to

do is cut two-centimetre thick slices. Use a 
serrated knife for this, and use the length of

the knife. So in a bowl we're going to add into 
here four eggs, lovely free-range eggs. In here

we're going to add some extra flavour. So i've 
got some vanilla paste, now this vanilla paste

have a little look here, you can get this in the 
supermarkets. Of course you can use a vanilla pod,

but this paste is incredibly convenient. A nice 
generous teaspoon of that goes in, a little sort

of heaped teaspoon or so of sugar goes in, whisk 
that up. Now at this time of year if I happened

to sort of stumble and have a little bit of 
Baileys, or sherry, or vin santo, oh by mistake

I might just put some of that in. But of course 
if you've got kids around you wouldn't put it in.

So whisk that up, and that's it. What we do 
now is we put our lovely slice of panettone

into our eggs, turn it around, and then we're 
going to take that lovely piece of panettone

and place it in the bottom of the pan. So what 
I'm going to do now is make kind of a sandwich,

okay. So there's two things that make this rock. 
I've got some beautiful tinned peaches here,

so I'll just line those up and I'll just slice 
those. And of course if you wanted to use pears,

strawberries, cherries - then I'm going to take 
these gorgeous peaches and I'm going to put them
on top of that piece of panettone in any old way,

stack them in there like that. Once you've done 
that get yourself 100 grams of chocolate. I've got

70% cocoa solids. What I do now is just break 
it up into little chunks, and this will ooze

and create little pools of chocolate. And then 
we've got the second piece of panettone here

and we go back in to that gorgeous flavoured eggs 
like that, and I do two things at this stage very

very simple. Pour any excess egg on top of our 
chocolate and fruit like that, and then simply

go on top like that. That's it guys - the job 
is done. With this dish it's not only just quick

to put together, but you could put that in the 
fridge the day before no trouble at all, right?

But when you come to cook it you simply put it 
on a medium-high heat for about three minutes,

maybe four minutes, just to get it going 
just to get a little bit of golden colour,

put a little bit of icing sugar which always makes 
me feel very festive. So on with some icing sugar,

and then under the grill. So look you can see 
we've got some sizzling happening. Just get

a little knife, have a little kind of look 
underneath. If it's looking lightly golden,

you're good to go. Then we can take it now from 
the hob to under the grill. The grill's on medium

and normally around 10 minutes is spot 
on, but basically when it's golden

and caramelised and gorgeous. 
Beautiful things are gonna happen.

Okay so it's had about 10 to 12 minutes 
- oh look at that! Sizzling on the top.

What's brilliant about the panettone is it is 
the smell of Christmas. So let's just serve it

on a beautiful board. Look at that. Let's get 
in there, and get a nice little slice - oh
come on! Let's have a little bit of icing sugar,

it's that time of year let's make it look 
festive. Vanilla ice cream, chocolate ice cream,

look at that. That my friends is a gorgeous, 
gorgeous dessert, and have a little look

onto the inside there look at that. 
Right let's have a little try of this.
Mm!

Scrumptious, the peach and the chocolate is a 
thing of joy, that is literally the simplest

little dessert ever and it feels like you've 
really put a lot of time and effort into it and

it was as simple as that. Panettone, eggs, 
vanilla, chocolate and fruit, happy days.
